pullRequest.body:
We define the contravariant functors between the categories of Frames and Topological Spaces and prove that they form an adjunction. 
Work started at the BIRS workshop "Formalization of Cohomology Theories", Banff, May 2023.

Co-authored-by: Anne Baanen <vierkantor@vierkantor.com>
Co-authored-by: leopoldmayer <leomayer@uw.edu>
Co-authored-by: Brendan Seamas Murphy <shamrockfrost@gmail.com>

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body: Probably also good idea to merge master into this branch since the version of Lean has changed a few times since this was written.
@samvang, are you currently working on this? If not, I can do a cleanup pass.

> @samvang, are you currently working on this? If not, I can do a cleanup pass.

Not currently working on this, please do if you feel like it, much appreciated!

I've golfed the code, but I haven't fixed the names. They are currently
1. Not capitalised properly
2. Dumped in the root namespace

Not sure which way to fix them, so please offer suggestions!
@j-loreaux asked me on Zulip to create a separate PR for the small coercion changes in Order/Hom/Lattice and Order/Hom/CompleteLattice. This is now PR #7796.

:v: samvang can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6596584823/job/17922783122)

Thanks for coming back to this.

Please feel free to merge this as soon as you have addressed Filippo's suggestions and my last round of nitpicks.

bors d+

Looking good, thanks.

Maybe one more round and good to go!

The suggestions are all just nitpicking / inlining / fixing non-terminal simps.

To get the suggestions to work you will need to add the following `simp` lemmas elsewhere:
```lean
namespace Set

variable {α : Type*}

-- Beneath `Set.setOf_true`
@[simp] theorem setOf_top : { _x : α | ⊤ } = univ := rfl

-- Beneath `Set.setOf_false`
@[simp] theorem setOf_bot : { _x : α | ⊥ } = ∅ := rfl

end Set

namespace TopologicalSpace.Opens

open Set

variable {α : Type*} [TopologicalSpace α]

-- Maybe near `TopologicalSpace.Opens.coe_top`
@[simp] theorem mk_univ : (⟨univ, isOpen_univ⟩ : Opens α) = ⊤ := rfl

-- Maybe near `TopologicalSpace.Opens.coe_bot`
@[simp] theorem mk_empty : (⟨∅, isOpen_empty⟩ : Opens α) = ⊥ := rfl

end TopologicalSpace.Opens
```

Once these suggestions have been made I think this is ready.

Thanks for coming back to this.

Please feel free to merge this as soon as you have addressed Filippo's suggestions and my last round of nitpicks.

bors d+

```suggestion
  obj X := ⟨Opens X.α, inferInstance⟩
```
Looks like don't need a section since no `variable`.

Don't need these anymore
```suggestion
  map_sSup' S  := by
```

Looks like this can be `simp` (worth checking it does actually fire)
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma elim_exists_prop (A : Prop → Prop) : (∃ p, (A p) ∧ p) ↔ (A True) := by aesop
```
and probably belongs in `Logic.Basic` (not sure exactly which line, not very important).

Can this be:
```suggestion
  IsOpen := Set.range (open_of_element_hom L)
```

If we put `elim_exists_prop` above (maybe via Logic.Basic) then I think we can get away with:
```suggestion
      suffices : ∃ x, x ∈ S ∧ Z x
      · simpa using this
      replace hxZ : x ∈ S ∧ Z x := by simpa [← h] using hxZ
      exact ⟨x, hxZ⟩
```

All the files I saw only list one name under copyright. I suppose @samvang is the right choice since you started the file.
```suggestion
Copyright (c) 2023 Sam v. Gool. All rights reserved.
```
There are countlessly many files copyrighted by both me and Bhavik.
I have no opinion about this.

Looks like we only need the last import, and it provides the rest transitively.
```suggestion
import Mathlib.Order.Category.FrmCat
```

I think a better lemma would be
```suggestion
@[simp] lemma Prop.exists (q : Prop → Prop) : (∃ p, q p) ↔ q True ∨ q False := by
```

This already exists (no pun intended), under `Prop.exists_iff`. I will remove this new simp lemma from the file and instead give a `Prop.exists_iff` hint to the two `simp`s in FrameAdjunction that need it. Thanks!

What's the type of `x` here? If it's a set, this should be
```suggestion
  toFun u := {x | u ∈ x}
```
Ah, nevermind. I think what you have is correct already.

```suggestion
@[simps]
def openOfElementHom : FrameHom L (Set (PT L)) where
```
thanks I add this.

```suggestion
namespace CategoryTheory.Locale
```

```suggestion
section pt_definition

variable (L : Type*) [CompleteLattice L]
```

```suggestion
def openOfElementHom : FrameHom L (Set (PT L)) where
```

```suggestion
  map_inf' a b := by simp [Set.setOf_and]
  map_top' := by simp
```

```suggestion
  isOpen_univ := ⟨⊤, by simp⟩
```

```suggestion
  obj L := ⟨PT L.unop, inferInstance⟩
  map f := ⟨fun p ↦ p.comp f.unop, continuous_def.2 <| by rintro s ⟨u, rfl⟩; use f.unop u; rfl⟩
```

```suggestion
section locale_top_adjunction

variable (X : Type*) [TopologicalSpace X] (L : Locale)
```

```suggestion
def localePointOfSpacePoint (x : X) : PT (Opens X) where
```

```suggestion
  map_sSup' S := by simp [Prop.exists_iff]
```

```suggestion
def counitAppCont : FrameHom L (Opens <| PT L) where
  toFun u := ⟨openOfElementHom L u, u, rfl⟩
  map_inf' a b := by simp
  map_top' := by simp
  map_sSup' S := by ext; simp
```

```suggestion
end CategoryTheory.Locale
```

Given that `Locale` is in the root namespace,
```suggestion
end Locale
```

```suggestion
namespace Locale
```

```suggestion
This file defines functors between the categories of Locales and of Topological Spaces
```
I will turn this into lowercase (and add the of). Thanks

```suggestion
* `pt`: the *points* functor from the category of Locales to the category of Topological Spaces.
```
Sorry I don't think that makes sense to capitalise non-Lean names.
Agreed, I will turn the first occurrence into lower case and leave these lower case.

```suggestion
* `topToLocale`: the forgetful functor from the category of Topological Spaces to the category of
```

```suggestion
  Locales.
```

```suggestion
- `locale_top_adjunction`: the theorem that `topToLocale`` is left adjoint to `pt``.
```

In the first line you used capital T, S, L for Topological Spaces and Locales, but quite consistently you write them with small letters from that point on. Perhaps all my comments should be forgotten and the first occurence is the one to change?

Names need to be fully qualified to work in our docs:
```suggestion
* `Locale.pt`: the *points* functor from the category of locales to the category of topological spaces.
```

This isn't actually defined here, right?
```suggestion
```
Indeed, thanks

As well as fully qualifying the names for docs, I suggest not to use the word "theorem" since there's data here (indeed it's a `def`):
```suggestion
- `Locale.adjunctionTopToLocalePT`: the left adjunction between `topToLocale` and `Locale.pt`.
```
OK. I rephrased your suggestion slightly ("left adjunction" sounds odd to me).
Isn't it covariant?
Oops yes. At some point the category of frames was changed into the category of locales (not by me) but the doc strings weren't updated accordingly...

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Adjunction between topological spaces and locales
